content.description: A very crimpy route that’s super fun! A good landing place and a classic spot for the area make for a great boulder. Start in the middle near the small crack at the bottom and head straight up. Great 3 finger pocket a little from the top adds some variety to all the pebble crimps.
content.location: Located directly under the tip of the “whales head” rock formation.

content.description: Start on the right side of the small corner. The arete, corner, and lay back are off. Work your way up to an easy topout.
content.location: Downhill and to the right from the main wall.

content.description: Stand start right in the middle of the Spade Boulder's North face and climb straight up through some fun crimps with bomber feet.
content.location: On the approach to the Main Wall, right before you are at the whale/turtle head, turn left (East) and follow a trail until the formation ends. At this point there is a cluster of free standing boulders. This boulder is amongst them.

content.description: Stand start on the arête left of Spade and follow it straight to the top.
content.location: Spade Boulder's North face. On the approach to the Main Wall, right before you are at the whale/turtle head, turn left (East) and follow a trail until the formation ends. At this point there is a cluster of free standing boulders. This boulder is amongst them.

content.description: Start lower left on the overhanging face on a shelf, follow the shelf up to its end then move up to the juggy top and top out.
content.location: On the stand alone boulder to the right of Moby Neil

content.description: Crimpy endurance traverse. Start right and move left, or left and move right. Better yet go back and forth!
content.protection: So low no pad is needed
content.location: Approaching the whale/turtle head don't go around to the South side (Main Wall side), follow the formation left (East) on a trail until the formation ends; you're now at some stand alone boulders where the problem "Spade" amongst others is. You'll see another formation starting past the open area, go there and continue onto the formation for a minute or two and you'll run into this problem.

content.description: With a sit start it’s a V0 until the roof to me, it’s a fun little pull up and top out.
content.location: After entering the front looking at the whale head (Moby Niel) head just right, under the formation to some rock stairs and there’s a 12 foot wall that can be bouldered throughout. Look for the obvious crack up the rock and right of the dead tree.

content.description: Up between the characteristic green streaks that lend to its name. Good holds and better feet. Pull the cap block for the top out.
content.location: Downhill side of the main wall.

content.description: From the left side corner of the fang boulder, traverse right and up; pulling over the right side to finish.
content.location: Downhill side of the Fang boulder.

content.description: Start out on some jugs and make some tenuous moves before finding some secure jugs. Top out on the cap block. The arete is off.
content.location: Around the small corner from the previous route. Downhill and to the right from the main wall.

content.description: Some fun problems are around the area. Nothing serious, just fun and funky.
